title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4.117 - Executive order no. 117: abolishing the board of public disclosure
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4.117 - Executive order no. 117: abolishing the board of public disclosure

State Regulations
1. Chapter 813 of
the Laws of 1987, as amended by chapter 108 of the Laws of 1988, created a

State Ethics Commission to monitor compliance with the State's new ethics law, which applies to all statewide elected officials, and State officers and
employees. The ethics law contains conflict of interest restrictions and
financial disclosure requirements, and provides the State Ethics Commission
with rule making, enforcement and advisory power with respect to the new
law. 2. The Board of Public

Disclosure, which was established in January 1983 pursuant to Executive Order

No. 3, and the conflict of interest restrictions and financial disclosure
requirements contained in such Order, will no longer be necessary when the new, more comprehensive State ethics law takes full effect on January 1, 1989. 3. Therefore, pursuant to
this Executive Order, the Board of Public Disclosure is abolished as of January
1, 1989, and Executive Order No. 3, dated January 8, 1983, is hereby revoked as
of January 1, 1989. Signed: Mario M. CuomoDated: December 28, 1988
[FN*] [Revoked by Executive Order No. 29 (George E. Pataki), infra.]
[FN[DAGGER]] [Revoked by Executive Order No. 5 (Eliot

Spitzer), infra.]
[Revoked by Executive Order No. 9 (David A. Paterson), infra.]
[Revoked by Executive Order No. 2 (Andrew M. Cuomo), infra.]

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
